TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PageScalingFactorRange extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies a range of percentages by which a printer can enlarge or reduce the print image on a page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You typically use this class to specify the scaling range that is supported by a printer with the <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities.PageScalingFactorRange%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> object.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum percentage of the range.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents a percentage.

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum percentage of the range.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents a percentage.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the <xref:System.String> representation of the range.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> representation of the scaling range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format is as follows:
(<xref:System.Printing.PageScalingFactorRange.MinimumScale%2A>, <xref:System.Printing.PageScalingFactorRange.MaximumScale%2A>)
